subject: Communication
title: Data Storytelling: Numbers That Move
description: A fast breakdown of Data Storytelling: Numbers That Move for builders.

hook.text: A slide full of charts puts an executive to sleep. One chart with a story behind it gets the budget approved.

buildup.text: Data storytelling combines data, narrative, and visualization to make numbers meaningful and actionable.

discovery.text: The key: don't present data. Present the insight. 'Revenue grew 12%' is data. 'Our new strategy worked' is a story.

twist.text: Most analysts fail because they show all the data. Great data storytellers show only the data that matters.

climax.text: Cole Nussbaumer Knaflic's framework: context (why), data (what happened), narrative (what it means), call to action.

punchline.text: Data informs. Stories from data transform.

quiz.question: What is the key difference between data presentation and data storytelling?
options: Presenting insight and meaning, not just numbers
